alert.note: Alert for Imperial County Southwest; Imperial County West (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued May 26 at 1:42AM PDT until May 26 at 7:00AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PDT THIS MORNING... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Advisory, west winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. For the second Wind Advisory, west winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Southwest corner of Imperial County and western Imperial County. * WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, until 7 AM PDT this morning. For the second Wind Advisory, from 4 PM this afternoon to 5 AM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne. Minor tree damage possible.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Imperial County Southwest; Imperial County West
